plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to eastern Asia, famous for its glossy leaves and large, beautiful flowers that bloom in winter. It thrives in mild climates and is often found in gardens and parks.
plants.location: East Asia, Southeastern USA, parts of Europe
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers inspired the logo of the famous French fashion house Chanel.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant native to mountainous regions of Europe, notable for its early winter blooming often around Christmas and New Year, with white to pink flowers that bring color to cold, shady areas.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name and rose-like flowers, Helleborus niger is not a rose but belongs to the buttercup family.

plants.name: Acacia baileyana
plants.description: An Australian native small tree or shrub with fern-like leaves and bright golden-yellow ball-shaped flowers, blooming in early to mid-summer, often extending into January in southern Australia.
plants.funFact: The fragrant flowers of Acacia baileyana are used by birds to build their nests.

plants.name: Magnolia grandiflora
plants.description: A large evergreen tree native to the southeastern United States, known for its large, creamy-white, fragrant flowers that bloom sporadically and can appear in winter months, especially in milder climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Mostly late spring to summer but can bloom sporadically in winter
plants.funFact: Southern Magnolia flowers can reach up to 30 centimeters (12 inches) in diameter, among the largest of any native plant in North America.
